page.title: 03ACASTER INTRODUCTION
page.content: Acaster Malbis originated as a Roman station on the Ouse,and the river has played an important part in its life. Fishing declined in the 1930s,and at the end of the second world war, tourism took over,with 9 caravan and camping sites,and a large residential caravan site.In the last ten years there has been some housing develop- ment and the commuters have moved in. There are eight working farms in the Parish and community spirit is still strong,fostered mainly by those who worship at the fourteenth century church and the 100 year old Methodist Chapel.Conserving our Rural heritage must be our priority for the future.
